terms.definition: accumulation of excess fluid in the peritoneal cavity (abdomen)
chronic dilation of the airways caused by the damaging effects of long-standing infection; symptoms include cough, sputum, wheezing, and shortness of breath

any of a group of debilitating, progressive, and potentially fatal lung diseases that have in common increased resistance to air movement, prolongation of the expiratory phase of respiration, and loss of the normal elasticity of the lung; includes emphysema, chronic obstructive bronchitis, chronic bronchitis, and asthmatic bronchitis
terms.aliases: chronic obstructive pulmonary diseases, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease COPD, chronic obstructive pulmonary diseases COPD, COPD

terms.definition: chronic liver disease characterized by scarring and loss of liver function
a patient-completed instrument comprising 8 items that can quantify the impact of COPD on a patient's health
terms.aliases: COPD Assessment Tests, COPD Assessment Test CAT, COPD Assessment Tests CAT, CAT

terms.definition: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease marked by abnormal increase in the size of the alveoli, causing damage to their walls and making it harder to breathe
the amount of air that can be expelled from the lungs in 1 second
terms.aliases: forced expiratory volumes in 1 second, forced expiratory volume in 1 second FEV1, forced expiratory volumes in 1 second FEV1, FEV1

terms.definition: yellowing of body tissues and fluids due to excessive levels of bilirubin in the bloodstream
an enzyme released by activated neutrophils during inflammatory or infectious processes
a 50-item, disease-specific instrument designed to measure impact on overall health, daily life, and perceived well-being in individuals with obstructive airways disease
terms.aliases: St Georges Respiratory Questionnaire, St George's Respiratory Questionnaires, St Georges Respiratory Questionnaires, St Georges Respiratory Questionnaire SGRQ, St Georges Respiratory Questionnaires SGRQ, SGRQ
